abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the
            Nicaragua and Honduras Corazon Transboundary Biosphere
            Reserve Project is to improve the national and binational
            management of the area of the Corazon Transboundary
            Biosphere Reserve (CTBR), respecting the rights of
            traditional populations. Given the difficulties experienced
            with implementation of this project, and given results to
            date, approval is being requested for a level one
            restructuring, which will involve: 1) a change in the
            objective that will eliminate binational commitments, which
            are not achievable under the current political climate and
            in the project timeframe, while maintaining the overarching
            goal of preserving the cross-boundary Corazon Reserve; 2)
            simplification of project design to focus on activities and
            components that are progressing well and where results have
            been achieved; 3) reallocation of funds, within original
            executing agency allocation, from non-performing components
            to those under which implementation mechanisms are
            functional, and where momentum to complete the proposed
            objectives has been built; and 4) revision of the results
            framework and monitoring arrangements to better capture and
            monitor the impacts of the project on conservation
            objectives of the CTBR. The restructuring proposal does not
            include an extension of the project's closing date.
